alert.note: Alert for Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 16 at 1:54AM MST until November 17 at 2:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM EARLY THIS MORNING TO 2 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 to 60 mph early Thursday morning into the early afternoon hours will create low visibilities and blowing snow at times. Wind gusts will decrease by sunset Thursday afternoon, but blowing snow may create reduced visibility at times. Highest snowfall accumulations will remain above 9000 feet in elevation. * WHERE...Snowy Range above 9000 feet in elevation. * WHEN...From 5 AM early this morning to 2 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Falling and blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and produce slick road conditions. Hikers, campers, and hunters could easily become disoriented.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
